page.title: 07SHOPS IN NASSINGTON.page b.
page.content: 9am to 5pm and on Wednesday and Saturday from 9am to 1pm.The top shop is called {Rowles}.It is rather old fashioned inside with lots of draws with special names on them.It sells groceries,sweets,hardware,vegetables, toys,fruit and ice-cream.The shop is closed on Sunday but opens every other day from 8am to 12.15pm and 2pm to 5pm except for Wednesday which is half day. Another shop sells {Waterford Glass and Crystal}.The owner used to be a glass blower at Waterford,Ireland.He also sells rather expensive pottery.People come from miles around to buy things. The last shop is an {Art Gallery}. Most people think that the village shops are more expensive than supermarkets in Stamford and Peterborough,but we have found that they are frequently cheaper,especially when the cost of travel is considered.
